data.title: Nishi Hongan-ji Kagoshima Betsuin
data.meta_description: The current building of this large Buddhist temple near Tenmonkan dates from 1982 and was renovated in 2013. Inside, it's unlike most temples you may have…
data.text:

2.21 MILES

17.37 MILES

There is perhaps no more eloquent monument to the futility of war than this harrowing museum about WWII kamikaze pilots. Around 2km west of town, Chiran’s…

Museum of the Meiji Restoration

0.75 MILES

This museum offers insights into the unique social system of education, samurai loyalty and sword techniques that made Satsuma one of Japan's leading…

Samurai Houses

16.15 MILES

Seven of the mid-Edo-period residences along Chiran’s 700m street of samurai houses have gardens open to the public. Water is usually symbolised in the…

Bandokorobana Shizen Kōen

24.92 MILES

Down a side road between Ibusuki and Makurazaki, this small-ish seaside nature park has been noted for its beauty since an Edo-period surveyor named it…

Kirishima-jingū

26.08 MILES

Picturesque, tangerine Kirishima-jingū has a good vantage point. Though the original dates from the 6th century, the present shrine was built in 1715. It…

Seahorse House

24.95 MILES

This chill, seaside seahorse hatchery is unique, offering close-up looks at thousands of hatchling seahorses, plus information, videos, souvenirs and a…

Chiringashima

23.01 MILES

Lovely Chiringashima is connected to the mainland by a thin land bridge that appears only at low tide, when hikers, beachcombers and tide-pool explorers…

1 . Saigō Takamori Statue

0.13 MILES

Kagoshima's most famous historical figure, Saigō Takamori has been called the 'last samurai' and was known as both a loyalist and a rebel. His statue is…

2 . Kagoshima City Museum of Art

0.17 MILES

The Kagoshima City Museum of Art has a small permanent collection of works by modern-day Kagoshima painters, as well as some 16th-century porcelains and…

4 . Terukuni-jinja

0.26 MILES

This famous shrine is in memory of Shimazu Nariakira (1809–58), celebrated 11th leader of the Satsuma clan in the late Edo period. He is credited with…

5 . St Francis Xavier Church

0.27 MILES

This landmark church, originally built in 1908 but rebuilt in 1999, honors the first Christian missionary to visit Japan.

6 . Reimeikan

0.33 MILES

7 . Statue of Ōkubo Toshimichi

0.72 MILES

This monument honours the Kagoshima samurai turned statesman (1830–78) who helped overthrow the feudal regime and pave the way for the modernisation of…
